headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MANN, ALFRED E

snippet: MANN--Alfred E. The officers, board and staff of the American Technion Society (ATS) mourn the loss of Mr. Alfred E. Mann, of Beverly Hills, CA. A noted scientist, and entrepreneur, Mr. Mann was a loyal supporter who established the Alfred Mann Institute for Biomedical Development at the Technion, focused on enabling commercialization of innovative biomedical technologies that improve human health. Together with his wife, Claude, Mr. Mann was a Technion Guardian, a designation reserved for those who have reached the highest level of commitment. He was awarded a Technion Honorary Doctorate in 2005. We extend our heartfelt condolences to Claude, and the entire Mann family. American Society for Technion-Israel Institute of Technology Zahava Bar-Nir, President Scott Leemaster, Chairman of the Board Jeffrey Richard, Executive Vice President Melvyn H. Bloom, Executive Vice President Emeritus 1/3
